results.title: A Half million teenagers
results.brief_description: Studies the physiology aspects of venereal disease. Uses animation to show how the organisms of gonorrhea and syphilis enter and affect the body and how the diseases may be recognised. Stresses the need for treatment, pointing out that there is a cure for both diseases.

results.title: Going Our Way
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Victorian Railways and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many employment opportunities in the Victorian Railways. A young boy playing with his toys, including a train, dreams of his future. He becomes a station assistant. Shows how he learns his job and benefits from the V.R.I. library and sporting clubs. Includes executive officers who started at the bottom and worked their way to the top.

results.title: Get out and live
results.brief_description:
This 1972 film, produced for the Main Roads Department, Brisbane, describes the establishment of an emergency control organisation within the department, and shows the training and implementation of an emergency evacuation of 1,500 people from the 14 storey office building.

Produced by Cameracraft Film Productions.

The colour is faded throughout the film and there are jumps in the soundtrack throughout due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Echoes in Freestone
results.creator_credit: Ray Barnes, John M. Bale and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Using sounds from the past, over pictures of the present, the film glimpses a man’s life in pioneering days. Set in the historic town of Richmond, Tasmania, the film shows some of the classic colonial Georgian houses and churches, many of which date from the early days.

results.title: Easy does it
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description:
This 1967 film is a light-hearted look at the correct methods of manual handling in order to avoid back strain and injury. The film shows footage of factory and manual labourers handling various heavy loads, including using equipment to aid safe lifting. This footage is interspersed with examples of everyday strain such as women hanging out the washing and lifting a baby from a pram; and moments of slapstick comedy as a man struggles to carry his bride over the threshold of their house and a man lifts a keg of beer at a barbeque.

Produced by Tasfilm Productions for the Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: The Blowfly menace
results.creator_credit: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: For farmers and graziers this study of the life-cycle of the green blowfly and other flies associated with blowfly strike in sheep, and demonstrations of various methods of control, should prove both useful and interesting.

results.title: Just a story
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Tony Paice and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: An attempt to show that storytelling is not just part of literature but is part of the everyday world around us and the ways in which we relate to each other. Demonstrates that our own experiences provide a rich source of information which may be drawn upon for the writing of stories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Tony Paice and Diane O’Connor

results.title: Crescent moon = Yueyaer  = 月牙儿
results.creator_credit: Zhanag Fan, Wang Zhi An, Huo Zhuang, Li Dong De, Xing Dan, Xu Xiaoxing and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Based on a short story written in the 1930s by Lao She, ‘Crescent Moon’ portrays the inexorable injustice exerted by an unfair economic system, through the reminiscences of a young girl gradually forced into prostitution by poverty. Yuerong’s father dies when she is only a little girl; her mother remarries a kind patron, but he dies too. Penury pushes her mother into prostitution, for which Yuerong cannot forgive her. She leaves home and lives at school, but after graduation is unable to find work. She lets a man take care of her for a while, but then discovers he is married. Later she becomes a waitress, but loses the job when she refuses to sleep with the customers. In the end she has no choice but to follow in her mother’s footsteps.

Credits: Directors, Huo Zhuang, Xu Xiaoxing, Xing Dan ; writers, Huo Zhuang, Zhang Fan, Wang Zhi’an ; photography, Sun Cheng, Meng Fanjun ; music, Liv Zhuang ; editing, Zhon Tingmei, An Xiaohua.
Cast: Song Dandan, Siqin Gaowa.
